attributes.action: please allow Ms Jade Goody and her husband (to-be) to spend their wedding night together
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Dear Sir

I am sure I am not alone in wanting to ask for some clemency to allow Jade and her fiance Jack Tweedy to be allowed to spend their wedding night together - not entirely for Mr Tweed's benefit, but for that of Jade herself.

I lost my 17-year-old nephew to cancer and the cutting short of a young life is almost unfathomable in its cruelty.

I appreciate fully that Mr Tweed has committed and been found guilty of a serious criminal act and that his punishment includes his punative curfew.  I am aware also that there are doubtless many more private individuals dealing with the same situation affecting Ms Goody and Mr Tweed.

However, should I ever have the misfortune to find a member of my own family in the same position, I would be making a similar plea on their behalf.

I appreciate that mine is only a single request; however, I have been so affected and deeply saddened by Jade's predicament that I respectfully ask for your consideration in this tragic matter.

Many thanks.

rejection.details: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office/Ministry of Justice - a decision was made on this case.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
